hypothesis_content.title: ETF Flow Anticipation Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: When US Bitcoin ETF net flows have been consistently positive (> $100M daily) for 3 consecutive days, a negative flow day will be preceded by a predictable pattern: price rallies into the 4 PM ET (20:00 UTC) flow announcement, then reverses 80% of the day's gains by midnight UTC, providing a short entry edge.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Consistent ETF inflows create a bullish narrative that gets priced in during the day. Traders front-run the expected positive flow announcement. When flows disappoint (or are negative), the 'sell the news' reaction is amplified. The timing edge comes from the predictable 4 PM ET data release and subsequent profit-taking by flow-chasers.
entry_conditions: BTC ETF net flows > $100M daily for 3+ consecutive days
Day 4: price is up > 1.5% from 14:00 to 19:30 UTC (into flow announcement)
Volume during rally is declining relative to 10-day average for that period
Short entry at 19:55 UTC (5 minutes before flow data release)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 80% of the day's gains (from 14:00 UTC low to entry price)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes new daily high after entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price continues rallying post-announcement in > 50% of cases, or median retracement is < 40% of day's gains by midnight UTC.
